items.title: Wiegman krijgt eervolle onderscheiding uit handen van koning Charles
items.summary: Sarina Wiegman heeft een fraaie onderscheiding ontvangen uit handen van de Britse koning Charles. Ze is maandag benoemd tot Honorary Dame Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire (DBE) vanwege haar uitzonderlijke verdiensten voor het Engelse voetbal.

items.title: Can 'Champagne Charlie' upset Van Veen and reach Ally Pally quarter-finals?
items.summary: 'Champagne' Charlie Manby takes on Gian van Veen at the World Darts Championship on Tuesday with a quarter-final spot on the line.

items.title: Archer, Tongue named in England's T20 World Cup squad
items.summary: Jofra Archer has been included in England's provisional T20 World Cup squad after his Ashes-ending injury, with fellow fast bowler Josh Tongue also named in a 15-player group for February and March's tournament in India and Sri Lanka.

items.title: Farioli lijkt na bijna perfecte seizoenshelft Benfica al kwijt in titelrace
items.summary: FC Porto pakte in het eerste deel van dit seizoen liefst 46 van de mogelijke 48 punten onder Francesco Farioli. Hoewel het tegen hekkensluiter AVS in de eerste helft behoorlijk moeizaam ging , werd er wel weer gewonnen. Daarmee is volgens de Portugese media concurrent Benfica al min of meer afgeschreven, maar over een titel wilde Farioli niet spreken.

items.title: Bosz leerde van transferzomer PSV: 'Dat moeten we niet meer doen'
items.summary: Na het winnen van de landstitel in het seizoen 2023/24 had Peter Bosz √©√©n doel: de selectie bij elkaar houden. Hij kwam er in het afgelopen seizoen achter dat dat makkelijker gezegd is dan gedaan. Nu zou Bosz het anders doen.

items.title: Honours for football executives who helped save Celtic and Hearts
items.summary: Former Celtic chief executive Fergus McCann and ex-Hearts chair Ann Budge have been recognised in the New Year Honours.

items.title: Wolverhampton hosts nine-race card on Tuesday
items.summary: Intervention and Accrual are set to face off in the feature contest tonight at Wolverhampton - live on Sky Sports Racing.

items.title: Reconstructie: de bizarre kampioensstrijd tussen PSV en Ajax
items.summary: Het kampioenschap van het seizoen 2024/25 draagt voor altijd het predicaat krankzinnig. De titelstrijd tussen Ajax en PSV kende een dubbele catastrofe, want beide topclubs beleefden een historische implosie. VI maakte een reconstructie van een bizarre race die pas op de slotdag van de competitie werd beslist.

items.title: Ronaldo wants 1k goals; open to Europe return
items.summary: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has reiterated his desire to reach 1,000 career goals before he calls time on his playing career.

items.title: Hakimi returns as Morocco seal AFCON knockouts
items.summary: Africa Cup of Nations hosts Morocco dispatched Zambia 3-0 at a fervid Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat on Monday to round off their Group A campaign in style and ease into the round of 16.

items.title: Wrexham into top half of Championship after win
items.summary: null

items.title: Why is the USWNT so low on the top 50 of ESPN FC Women's Rank?
items.summary: For the first time ever, a USWNT player isn't in the top 20 of ESPN FC Women's Rank, our list of the top 50 players in the world. Why?

items.title: Ranked: The top 50 women's soccer players in the world
items.summary: An expert panel of coaches, GMs and journalists ranked the 50 best women's soccer players in the world.

items.title: Hakimi neemt Marokkaanse schrik bij rentree weg
items.summary: Achraf Hakimi en Walid Regragui kijken uit naar het restant van de Afrika Cup met Marokko. De rechtsback nam de schrik die was ontstaan bij zijn rentree meteen weg, terwijl de bondscoach uitlegde hoe hij toch steeds maar weer dealt met de kritische opinie van de Marokkaanse fans.

items.title: Littler 'given a work-out' but battles past Cross
items.summary: Rob Cross made the world number one work for it, but Luke Littler stood firm to book his place in the quarter finals.

items.title: Sarina Wiegman an honorary dame as Lionesses and Red Roses get honours
items.summary: Leah Williamson made an OBE; four Lionesses are MBEs Torvill and Dean now a dame and a knight Sarina Wiegman has been awarded an honorary damehood after guiding England to back-to-back European titles, in a new year honours list dominated by the Lionesses and England‚Äôs victorious women‚Äôs rugby union team. The Red Roses‚Äô World Cup success on home soil has led to the captain, Zoe Aldcroft, the vice-captain, Marlie Packer, and the head coach, John Mitchell, named OBEs, while Megan Jones, Sadia Kabeya and Ellie Kildunne become MBEs. Continue reading...

items.title: Wiegman gets honorary damehood in New Year Honours
items.summary: Ice skaters Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean become a dame and knight in the New Year Honours list, while England women's manager Sarina Wiegman is made an honorary dame.

items.title: Wiegman an honorary dame as Lionesses and Red Roses awarded honours
items.summary: England Lionesses and England Red Roses were recognised with awards in the New Year Honours list after securing more major silverware in 2025.

items.title: Jordan James completes double over Derby to lift sour mood at Leicester
items.summary: Doing a December double over Derby may have offered Leicester fans some festive cheer but it is unlikely to brook the festering resentment against a board whose treatment of staff over Christmas has only exacerbated the ill will around the King Power Stadium. First-half goals from Bobby De Cordova-Reid and Jordan James sandwiched Rhian Brewster‚Äôs equaliser to earn Mart√≠ Cifuentes, the manager, some respite after successive defeats. Leicester are four points off the playoff zone going into Thursday‚Äôs visit to Sheffield United but there are still plans for fans to boycott next Monday‚Äôs televised game with West Brom. Continue reading...

items.title: Aston Villa defy gravity again as winning run rolls on at Chelsea | Jonathan Wilson
items.summary: Villa keep coming from behind, keep winning by the odd goal and keep confounding the numbers. At some point it must stop ‚Äì but not yet It can‚Äôt go on. It makes no sense that it goes on. And yet it goes on. Aston Villa went into Saturday‚Äôs Premier Leage game at Chelsea having won 10 games in a row, looking to match a record set in 1897 and 1914. For an hour there seemed no chance they would achieve it, as Chelsea outplayed them, took the lead and could have had several more. But Chelsea are vulnerable with a lead, especially at home, and Villa have developed a baffling habit of winning away games having gone behind. This is an extract from Soccer with Jonathan Wilson, a weekly look from the Guardian US at the game in Europe and beyond. Subscribe for free here. Have a question for Jonathan? Email soccerwithjw@theguardian.com, and he‚Äôll answer the best in a future edition. Continue reading...
